tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Saba, Ayah 1?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The fact of the Universe being extremely congenial and conducive to the nourishment of human life clearly shows that its Creator is extremely kind and merciful towards His creation
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Saba, Ayah 3?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The addressees of the Quran were not disbelievers in the Day of Judgement. The world they lived in appeared safe to them and they could not, therefore, understand how they would be in jeopardy on reaching the world Hereafter
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: There are clear signs in heaven and on earth which show man’s helplessness. They did so due to their disbelief in the Hereafter and because in their hearts they were not fearful of God’s scourge; this made them quite flippant about the affairs of the Hereafter
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When a believer who is fully absorbed in the remembrance of God recites the praises of God, he is in fact in consonance with the entire Universe; all things in heaven and on the earth join him in chorus, albeit in silent language
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Saba, Ayah 12?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: With God’s further blessing, his ships always had favourable winds. From head to foot, he is the manifestation of His Grace
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The jinn continued with their work under the impression that he was nearby supervising the work. It so happened that some white ants infested the stick and after some time, when the white ants had made the stick hollow, his body fell on to the ground

This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It was spread over the area at present known as Yemen. In the period before Christ, it had made great progress and remained at its zenith for about one thousand years

This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Saba, Ayah 18?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: On account of their improper behaviour, they lost their right to avail of these divine blessings. Travelling in this area was a pleasant experience, enough to kindle the spirit of thankfulness and devotion in man

This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: They were influenced by and succumbed to the satanic inducements and trod the path to destruction. There were but a few (true believers) who were successful in this test
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Every age has had many believers in the Hereafter, yet Satan has propagated such erroneous beliefs as have made the unbelievers fearless of the Hereafter
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Such a universe can be the accomplishment of the All-powerful, All-wise God alone. No one can seriously believe that those beings, whom ancient or modern man has invented can be the creators or lords of this universe
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Thereafter, the reward or punishment, according to the response of the people, is for God to decide—in this world as well as in the Hereafter. But, since the institution of prophethood ended with him, he is now, by order, mubashshir and munzir for all the nations in the world
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But, in the Hereafter, when the adverse effect of denying the Truth impinges on the deniers, they will be caught in a state of turmoil. The common people, in this world, were proud of their leaders, but once in the Hereafter, they will curse them
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Saba, Ayah 34?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: These are the people who will be treated as deserving of God’s eternal blessings and rewards in the Hereafter. Such people do not give due importance to the Hereafter, even when they are warned of it
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: So, throughout the world, idols of angels were set up and worshipped. In the Hereafter, the angels will dissociate themselves from such worshippers and neither God nor the angels will give them any support
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The sole reason for this success was that the disbelievers played on the sentiments of the common people and stirred them up by saying that it (the Quran’s message) was against the traditions of their forefathers
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Saba, Ayah 46?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The contemporaries of the Prophet rejected his call of Truth, but this rejection was purely due to stubbornness and prejudice. Viewing him dispassionately, people would have come to know that his restlessness was not out of madness but because of the danger which he was required to warn against
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The world has been created on the basis of Truth. In this world, sometimes Truth is unable to triumph over untruth
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When an individual rejects the Truth in the present world, the result of doing so is not immediately apparent. The Truth which was presented to them in this world was so powerful that they found themselves unable to reject it on the basis of reasoning
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
